ratings.comment: Smart guy awful class. Everything about it is confusing and disorganized. Tests were extremely difficult with class averages ~45%. I would not recommend this class even to my enemy

This guy should not be teaching undergraduate students. Lectures are super confusing and not worth your time, and the assignments are super vague with no guidance on how they are graded. This class could be interesting but the disorganization makes it difficult to stay engaged. Super smart and accomplished guy but terrible class.

I found the class to be pretty easy if you already have a basic understanding of policy issues.  I agree with the other reviews that Prof. Chinn assigns work very close to the deadlines with unclear instructions, so be prepared.  Otherwise the guest lectures are fun and Prof. Chinn tries to include topics that are of interest.

P. Chinn's lectures are very average. What makes his class a pain is his assignments. He waits until the last minute to post instructions. When he does post them they are unclear and contain contradictions. On top of that a clear grading criteria is nonexistent. Only take his class if have given up on caring about your grade or learning anything.

The grading in this class was completely unclear. I ended the course which would have been an A on a normal grading scale but received a B because the curve hurt me so much. The lectures were very all over the place and the criteria was never clear. Prof. Chinn was very kind but not a professor I would take for this class again.

Professor Chinn is so sweet. He kind of looks like a little old man that you just want to give a hug. I really enjoyed his class and thought that everything he said was very insightful. Only a few assignments but the were graded very easily.Not sure why everyone is being so dramatic on here, I thought this class was super easy and very interesting!

I got what would normally be an AB, but got a BC in this course, due to the curve. My roommate took this course with another professor & had a much better experience. So much lack of information and very little guidance. If you actually want to learn about public policy, not economics, save yourself and take this with any other possible professor.

This class was super unorganized. For the first midterm, we asked him several times whether a specific chapter he hadn't gone over in lecture would be on the midterm. He said no. Then he said yes. He also said there wouldn't be specific statistics from the lectures on his exam. Most MC questions had stats from that lecture he never went over...

He had a lot more econ involved in PUB AFFR 200 than previous profs, but overall interesting and good prof. My 84 on a midterm corresponded to a BC, so a bit confused on that but overall he is great for pub affr, attendance is not mandatory for lecture (go to discussion) and there's a midterm in class, two writing assignments, and take home final.

He is really good at econ but terrible at teaching. Lectures are disorganized and many topics require modules you might never know before but he assumes you know them. Even though I got an A, I still never recommend the course ECON442. He may be good at other courses but never this.

I do get an A in the final. However, I will never recommend this course and the professor unless you don't care about GPA  and really interest in macroeconomic. Too much time spent on real world, it is cool but never helps your grade.
Menzie Chinn is a very famous economist and it was a great experience to take his class. The 10 page term paper at the end was a bear.

I would probably recommend the class to someone who finds macro-policy interesting, maybe not a class for every econ major though.  He includes real world info to add context, but if you are just concerned about your grade you may find it confusing. Exams and homework were predictable, but go to office hours to make sure you know what you need to.

This class is what you make of it. Chinn is a pretty good lecturer and is great at integrating current events and real world data into the material, but you have to follow along, pay attention, and occasionally research things yourself.

Very nice Professor. Lectures can be challenging but you learn a lot about the Financial Markets and Banks, so I was very interested in it. A must take for everybody studying economics and aiming for a banking career.

His exams are very predictable and almost the same to problem sets. He is a very well-regarded economists who bring real world stuff into the classroom. I would suggest him for those that are interested in macroeconomics.
Very interesting class. Almost no homework, although the work that was required was difficult. He knows his stuff and is pretty good at explaining.

I have had him for econ 302 and econ 435. He is a fantastic professor. Very difficult (as classes should be at a public ivy school), but he is not unfair at all. If you do the homework, you will do well on the exams. His classes are advanced but will prepare you extremely well. Oh, and he answers emails incredibly fast. TL;DR Not easy, but great!
Honestly the worst professor I've had yet. His models and algebraic emphasis are completely unnecessary for the level of this class. Steer clear of this professor
Lectures were boring and not very useful.  Not a fun class, but you gotta do what you gotta do, I guess.

Chinn is a tough professor, and his lectures are full of daunting algebra. Understand the logic behind the equations and you'll do OK. Go to discussion, office hours, and read the book and you'll do well. Will require a good amount of studying, but the class is nowhere near impossible. I had Ao for a TA and she helped a lot, much more than lecture.

Even if you know the material up and down and backwards if you don't present it in the exact right way you will not get points on exams. The exams are super hard, you will walk out feeling like you rocked it and get it back and be shocked. Avoid avoid avoid he is the worst econ professor I've had. Save yourself
Going through 302, avoid this professor. Horribly boring lectures, difficult exams. Can't think of anything good to say about this class.
I will never take a class with this class again. He gave my class a problem set in the very last week of class right when our finals were nearly started. He concentrates way too much on finance.
He teaches too much Keynes, but the class is pretty easy overall. Do the practice tests and go to the TA review sessions are you should get at least a B.
Don't worry. You'll never get an A in this class.

He is not a good teacher. He puts the slides and handouts online... but usually days late because he knows no one goes to class. I barely attended and still got a B but that was because people did much worse then me. Material is not hard he just does not know how to teach it.

Let's make it clear, his lectures ARE boring but he makes it clear and repeats the materials to help you understand. I pretty much depended upon the TA sessions and textbooks so go to discussions. they really do help you preparing for the exams. Exams were tough, especially the multiple choice questions, but overall you'll do good if well-prepared.

Gotta agree with below, well put. The extra stuff is kind of interesting because its current issues things but it usually takes half the class before he makes it to the actual material. Exam multiple choice is *very* difficult, feels like every one is a guess. Hardest econ class (prof) i've taken so far.

Chinn was awful. If you can take 302 with any other professor do that. This class was boring and he went at his own pace without caring if the students understand what he went over. He makes handouts that are supposed to augment the textbook but they basically just turn into him showing off and adding extraneous material for no reason. Awful class.
unreal, you better have econ 302

make sure you have a good ta.  my ta clarified concepts each week and actually taught me more in one discussion then menzie did in two lectures.  he rambles and stutters in lectures and they are extremely hard to get through.  he rips off the examples that he goes through in lectures straight from the text.
Boring lectures but he is very clear and his homework and lectures totally prepare you for tests.
No Comments
No Comments
Boring class. Tests are allrgiht.
